intro: Biscutella microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruits are small, dry pods containing several seeds, and it is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils. Biscutella microcarpa is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
